intro: Lachemilla rusbyi, commonly known as Rusby's stonecrop, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its compact growth habit and vibrant floral display make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine collections. Lachemilla rusbyi is also valued for its ability to tolerate cold temperatures and its low maintenance requirements.
